title: In-class Ex02
text:
Code
install.packages("maptools", repos = "https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/2023-10-13")


Installing package into 'C:/Users/LENOVO/AppData/Local/R/win-library/4.3'
(as 'lib' is unspecified)


package 'maptools' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked

The downloaded binary packages are in
    C:\Users\LENOVO\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmpk1WWiD\downloaded_packages




Code
pacman::p_load(sf, raster, spatstat, tmap, tidyverse)




Code
mpsz_sf <- st_read(dsn = "data", 
                layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)


Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `D:\cbzhang2023\ISSS626-1\In-class_EX\In-class_EX02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21


Code
sg_sf <- mpsz_sf %>%
  st_union
plot(sg_sf)











Code
## sf use as.ppp
## polygon as.p. ???
## owin ?






Code
childcare_sf <- st_read("data/child-care-services-geojson.geojson") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)


Reading layer `child-care-services-geojson' from data source 
  `D:\cbzhang2023\ISSS626-1\In-class_EX\In-class_EX02\data\child-care-services-geojson.geojson' 
  using driver `GeoJSON'
Simple feature collection with 1545 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6824 ymin: 1.248403 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84




Code
childcare_ppp <- as.ppp(childcare_sf)


Warning in as.ppp.sf(childcare_sf): only first attribute column is used for
marks




Code
sg_owin <- as.owin(sg_sf)




Code
childcareSG_ppp = childcare_ppp[sg_owin]




Code
kde_childcareSG_bw <- density(childcareSG_ppp,
                              sigma=bw.diggle,
                              edge=TRUE,
                            kernel="gaussian") 







Code
childcareSG_ppp.km <- rescale.ppp(childcareSG_ppp, 1000, "km")

kde_childcareSG_adaptive <- adaptive.density(childcareSG_ppp.km, method="kernel")

gridded_kde_childcareSG_ad <- as(
  kde_childcareSG_adaptive,
  "SpatialGridDataFrame"
)
spplot(gridded_kde_childcareSG_ad)

title: In-class EX01
text:
Code
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, sf, tmap, ggstatsplot)



:::


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)
library(tmap)
library(ggstatsplot)




Code
mpsz14_shp = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                      layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")


Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `D:\cbzhang2023\ISSS626-1\In-class_EX\In-class_EX01\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21


The code for read kml:


Code
mpsz14_kml <- st_read("data/geospatial/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml")




Code
st_write(mpsz14_shp,
         "data/geospatial/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml",
         delete_dsn = TRUE)


Deleting source `data/geospatial/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' to data source 
  `data/geospatial/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing 323 features with 15 fields and geometry type Multi Polygon.




Code
mpsz14_kml <- st_read("data/geospatial/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml")


Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `D:\cbzhang2023\ISSS626-1\In-class_EX\In-class_EX01\data\geospatial\MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 2 fields

Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0

Code
mpsz19_shp <- st_read(dsn = "data/",
                      layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>%
st_transform(crs = 3414)


Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `D:\cbzhang2023\ISSS626-1\In-class_EX\In-class_EX01\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84




Code
popdata2023 <- read_csv("data/respopagesextod2023.csv")


Rows: 100928 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
dbl (2): Pop, Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.




Code
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP) %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[14])) %>%
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:13]) # Aged 25 - 59
         + rowSums(.[15])) %>% # Aged 60 - 64
  mutate(`AGED` = rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
  mutate(`TOTAL` = rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%
  mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`) 
          / `ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`,
         `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`,
         `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)


`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.




Code
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ),
            .funs = list(toupper)) %>%
  filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` > 0)




Code
mpsz_pop2023 <- left_join(mpsz19_shp, popdata2023,
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))




Code
write_rds(mpsz_pop2023, "data/mpszpop2023.rds")




Code
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2023) +
  tm_polygons()









Code
qtm(mpsz_pop2023, 
    fill = "DEPENDENCY")
